boardgame.name: Honey\Runner_
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are CYBERPUNKS who live in the shadows, and on the net. You make Runs against giant Mega-Corporations to crack the Honey out of them.

It’s DATACON 2077, where all the Mega-Corps show off their upcoming products. You are going to undertake the greatest heist the world has ever seen. Two things-

One: You have CYBERware surgically grafted into your body.

Two: You are a goddamn PUNK.

boardgame.name: Skate or Die
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the distant future, the year 2006, only the most radical of teens survive. Your parents don't understand, your peers judge you, and the cops are pigs. It's not much different from now, except for one golden rule...

You either Skate or you Die.

boardgame.name: The Hedgerow Hack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Old Shires are in peril. The Danes advance, burning thatch and bushel; the Puritans tear down Maypoles; the iron railways cut through leaf and lane; in the Otherworld, barrows open and dragons take flight across the darkening woods.

But you are here to defend the oldest places and forgotten ways. The Briar Company of Sky & Furrow are champions of the dwindling Light against the encroaching Dark. As Briar Knights, you travel in time, from the modern era to the medieval past, or pass through the Hedge to the Otherworld of fantastic fable.

boardgame.name: The Hedgerow Hack Player Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Briar Company of Sky & Furrow are champions of the dwindling Light against the encroaching Dark. As Briar Knights, you travel in time, from the modern era to the medieval past, or pass through the Hedge to the Otherworld of fantastic fable.

This expansion offers you player aids for character creation, expanded backgrounds for the ld Shires and the Otherworld, rules for child characters, detailed discussions of the Heathen Saints and Ouzel lineages, new powers, rules clarifications and more.

boardgame.name: Escape from Stalingrad Z
boardgame.description:
Escape from Stalingrad Z is a solo/coop campaign game of tactical combat which is set in the horrific zombie plague of World War Two. The year is 1942 and the city is Stalingrad. Your survivors are veteran soldiers fighting to stave off the zombie hordes in a war-torn wasteland while finding a way to escape from the decimated city. They must work together to find the best path, each scenario giving them options on which way to go next. The player's choices determine the fate of their heroes.

The game plays out over a series of linked scenarios that form a campaign. Each previous scenario in the Campaign will affect the start of the next, creating an ongoing story.

boardgame.name: CBR+PNK
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

CBR+PNK is a tabletop RPG for one-shot sessions in the cyberpunk genre. Player characters are a team of RUNNERS — mercs, criminals, activists living on the edge and running in the shadows of a gritty, ultraviolent world.

In each game we play an entire new cast of characters making their LAST RUN.

The game uses a minimalist version of the acclaimed Forged In The Dark system to produce cinematic action.

boardgame.name: Calabozo: Clásico Montecarlo de colección
boardgame.description:
Become a true legendary hero, get involved in the CALABOZO and with your fabulous skills attack and destroy monsters to obtain the treasures that will lead you to victory.

Each type of Dungeon adventurer needs a different amount of treasure to win. When a player accumulates enough treasure cards whose value is greater than or equal to the amount needed by his adventurer, that player must then return with his treasure to the exit.

How to play: On your turn you will roll a die to advance and try to reach the monster rooms. Once there, you will roll 2 dice to see if you defeat the enemy and gain the treasure in that room. In case of not defeating it, you will roll the 2 dice again to know what damage the monster causes you.
(the treasures sometimes gives you special powers)

The first player to bring enough treasure to the exit will win!

boardgame.name: SantaCraft
boardgame.description:
A massive blizzard has struck the North Pole and wiped out Santa's Village. His reindeer and sleigh are being held by the Abdominal (not a typo!) Snowman. Dig your way through snow, cut down gingerbread trees, and mine candy canes as you try to rescue your missing reindeer, rebuild Santa's Village, and save Christmas!

We made this game to celebrate the joy and silliness of the Christmas stories we love. So grab a mug of hot cocoa, relax, and join us for a little taste of Christmas. We hope you enjoy playing it as much as we enjoyed making it!

Features
- Mining and crafting
- Build Santa's Village with gingerbread houses, Christmas trees, and more
- Cute reindeer
- Quests from Abominable, Abdominal, and Adorable Snowmen (among others)
- Tools made of candy
- Fishing for saltwater taffy
- Santa!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Jan 15, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Arcanis Dodecadrome

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Jan 08, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Classic Style Dungeon

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: FutureGrind
boardgame.description:
Nail the perfect line in the future's most challenging stunt sport!

Grab your bike and hit the rails in FutureGrind, a stylish stunt-platformer all about tricks, skill, and speed. Use your futuristic bike to chain together huge combos on tracks made of floating rails, but watch out: touch the wrong color and you'll explode instantly!

Keep your sponsors happy and you'll find yourself earning new bikes and racing mind-bending tracks built for the pros. But not everything is as it seems. Someone is watching your every move. Who is it, and what do they really want with you?

Think you have what it takes? Test your limits while grinding to the bass pounding beats of an original soundtrack.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Sidewords
boardgame.description:
Grab a cup of coffee and relax with Sidewords

Sidewords is part logic puzzle, part word game, all original.

No timers. No penalties. No pressure. Just you and a good puzzle.

Sharpen your mind with hundreds of puzzles, from small and quick, to large and captivating. Plus three new puzzles to do every day! There’s even a bonus game included!

Choose a color scheme that fits your mood and environment. Get your morning started with bright colors, or unwind at the end of a long day with a dark theme.

So sit back, relax, and enjoy a good puzzle. You deserve your Sidewords time.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Beat Boys
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

THE 80’S ARE BACK!

Beat Boys is an RPG inspired by 80’s and 90’s aesthetics. It has light and easy to learn rule system, and the best part, using six-sided dice only!

Build your character with a few minutes and hit the streets spraying kicks and punches for free (valid only for evil ninjas).

boardgame.name: P-K-D: Phiction-Knosis-Deth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Phiction-Knosis-Deth is a rules-lite RPG of 1970s paranoid conspiracy and investigation. It contains a 5-page player's guide and a 5-page gamemaster's guide of brutally efficient rules designed to plunge players into a terrifying vortex of unstable reality as they take on the role of an out-of-their-depth average Dick or Jane called from their mundane life to serve as cosmic cannon fodder in a conflict they neither started nor fully understand.

P-K-D has been intentionally designed to accommodate both longer, investigative campaigns and pick-up-and-play, fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants RP sessions. The game uses a simple roll under 1d10 system, character creation is lightning-fast, and the game is sprinkled liberally throughout with helpful random tables for the gamemaster.

Along with a basic setting and rules system, P-K-D offers an exportable mechanic for creating and resolving the universe-melting paradoxes that can come with time-travel, overlapping realities, or world-altering magic. If you've ever wanted to drive the metaphysical laws of the universe insane right alongside your characters, P-K-D can help you do it.

So drop the needle on that Jefferson Airplane LP, pour yourself some funny-tasting Kool-Aid, and take a long, strange trip with P-K-D.

boardgame.name: Goodman Games Yearbook #8: The Year that Shall Not Be Named
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The annual Goodman Games community-building sourcebook is back—but let’s not talk about the year!
The year that shall not be named: it was the year we all learned to game online, and we shall celebrate it for that.

In the latest annual community yearbook from Goodman Games, the company celebrates what made this year special. Online connections brought regular gaming back to our lives, and the convention season took on a whole new look.

As always, this volume contains a wealth of new DCC RPG content, including new monster fumble tables and new mighty deed rules. There is an interview with TSR legend Russ Nicholson, a new mini-adventure, and pictures and photographs from this year – the year we want to forget but can’t help remembering.

At least we can remember the good times, including Cyclops Con, DCC Day, Bride of Cyclops Con, and all the great online games.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgseries: Goodman Games Gen Con Program Guides

boardgame.name: SINS: Spheres of Torment – Trilogy Box
boardgame.description:
SINS is a deck-destructor and a highly competitive game. It’s built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Both attacking and defending will cost you deeply and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage. Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit and fight
back when your opponent is exhausted.

Each battle pack of cards has a specific sin and each sin has a unique set of principles, which can either form or change your strategy as you play through the game.

SINS: Spheres of Torment introduces 3 different themed battle packs focus around the sins of wrath, greed and gluttony which supports 2-6 players.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: SINS: Era of Sloth – Battle Pack
SINS: Eyes of Envy – Battle Pack
SINS: Mark of Lust – Battle Pack
SINS: Spawn of Minions – Trilogy Box
SINS: Era of Sloth – Battle Pack
SINS: Eyes of Envy – Battle Pack
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: SINS: Gloom of Greed – Battle Pack
boardgame.boardgameintegration: SINS: Mark of Lust – Battle Pack
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: SINS: Ooze of Gluttony – Battle Pack
SINS: Rise of Wrath – Battle Pack
boardgame.boardgameintegration: SINS: Spawn of Minions – Trilogy Box

boardgame.name: Country Roads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Country Roads is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Country Roads is a standalone set, comprising 5 30x30 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique rural road, in an agricultural area, idea for quick encounters when your party is exploring a hex, or travelling between cities and towns. Whilst each tile works perfectly well on its own, they can also be joined together (in sequence) to make a long stretch of country road.

boardgame.name: Country Roads - Winter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Country Roads is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Country Roads - Winter is a standalone set, comprising 5 30x30 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique winter rural road, in an agricultural area, idea for quick encounters when your party is exploring a hex, or travelling between cities and towns. Whilst each tile works perfectly well on its own, they can also be joined together (in sequence) to make a long stretch of country road, draped in light/moderate snow and muddy tracks.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Gauntlight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Enter the megadungeon! When the mysterious Gauntlight, an eerie landlocked lighthouse, glows with baleful light, the people of Otari know something terrible is beginning. The town's newest heroes must venture into the ruins around the lighthouse—and delve the dungeon levels far beneath it—to discover the evil the Gauntlight heralds. Hideous monsters, deadly traps, and mysterious ghosts all await the heroes who dare to enter the sprawling megadungeon called the Abomination Vaults!

"Ruins of Gauntlight" is a Pathfinder adventure for four 1st-level characters. This adventure begins the Abomination Vaults Adventure Path, a three-part, monthly campaign in which the heroes explore a sprawling megadungeon to stop an ancient evil from renewing her monstrous vengeance. This adventure also includes an extensive gazetteer of the town of Otari, the heroes' home base, as well as new monsters, new rules, and new artifacts—including the dread Gauntlight itself!

boardgame.name: Bestial Ancestries: The Medusae
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bestial Ancestries: The Medusae is a book that contains an ancestry option made for use with "PF2E”. The Medusae are an often villified race of people that are thought of as being monsters and scourges of chaos and evil that live only to subvert any authority that isn't their own. While it is true that some Medusae follow these stereotypes and are the reason that such legends and myths exist about their people, the Medusae race as a whole are just as varied in belief and culture as any of the more common races of the world.

Inside this book you will find:

Our version of Medusae history and how their experiences and treatment have influenced their behaviors and culutures as a result.
The phyiscal characteristics of Medusae and the various supernatural aspects of them that arise from their uniquely occult energies and blood.
Statistics, traits, features, and abilities for players who wish to play as a member of the mysterious and powerful Medusae race.
4 Distinctly unique ancestral heritages that reflect the Medusae's supernatural connection to petrification and serpents. 1 semi-versatile heritage that reflects the Medusae's ability to integrate themselves into the communities of the other races of Golarion over many thousands of years.
20 Ancestral feats reflecting the many supernatural abilities of Medusae such as their petrifiying gazes and their unique abilities that embody their unique connections to the aspects of serpents.
Items and Rituals that showcase the esoteric and supernatural nature of the Medusae as a people.

boardgame.name: Abomination Vaults Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Abomination Vault Player's Guide gives players everything they need to create characters for their adventures around Otari and the megadungeon nearby. Within this spoiler–free guide, you'll find:

Recommendations for alignments, ancestries, classes, languages, and skills that make good choices for the Abomination Vaults Adventure Path.

Seven new backgrounds, including bibliophile, ruin delver, and starwatcher.

An introduction to the Cosmic Caravan Pantheon concerning constellations, fortune-telling, the night, hope for a better tomorrow.

A gazetteer of the town of Otari.

boardgame.name: Bestial Ancestries: The Taurine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bestial Ancestries: The Taurine is a book that contains an ancestry option made for use with "PF2E”. The taurine are an alchemically/magically created race of people that have existed for hundreds of years. The taurine race is one of the youngest in existence, but their roots are based in humans and minotaurs, meaning they've had much experience with the world ancestrally far before they ever became taurines. Inside this book you will find:

The origins of the taurine and how they live in the world today.
The phyiscal characteristics of taurines and how their environments, history, and experiences have changed them over the years.
Statistics, traits, features, and abilities for players who wish to play as a member of the strong and vigorous taurine race.
6 unique ancestral heritages that reflect the reflect the cultural, regional, and historical differences between the many lineages of taurine people.
19 Ancestral feats reflecting the physical prowess, nomadic culture, and strange magical history that all taurines share.
Items developed and used by the taurines in their many hundreds of years of existence, with many showcasing how they've adapted to their change in physical form.

boardgame.name: The Ruin: A Post-Apocalyptic RPG (The D20 Bare Bones Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world fell and now you need to survive!

The Ruin is a dark and gritty Post Apocalyptic RPG using the 5th edition rules of the worlds most popular RPG, everything you need is inside this book.

The world of The Ruin was destroyed by an invasion from another dimension, creatures determined to terraform the Earth into a world they could live, but in order to save our planet we almost destroyed it.

The Ruin is not a Zombie game but more a true apocalyptic experience, no mutants or even mutations just you against wild animals, gangs, raiders and disease, more akin to movies like the Book of Eli and The Road then The Walking Dead.

Within the game are:


7 classes to choose from
All rules for combat and vehicle combat
Gear and weapon tables
How to build a Settlement
4 City Guides
17 pages of threats
Encounter tables
Rules for surviving the wastes


So Grab your Scrap Gun and start exploring the wastes of The Ruin RPG

User summary:

See also The Ruin: A Post-Apocalyptic RPG (The D100 Bare Bones Edition)

boardgame.name: Likely To . . . A Game About Personalities
boardgame.description:
In this 3-5 player game, each player is assigned a color. During each round, a card reader reads a descriptive card that describes a certain type of personality (ex. Likely To Run For Political Office, Likely To Wear Gym Shorts In A Blizzard, Likely To Cook Like A Chef). Players race to be the first to match another player's personality to the one described on the card. However, if they say the wrong color, or are too slow, another player can steal their point. Whoever reaches 10 points first wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The District Quick-Start Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The District is a Post-Apocalyptic RPG set in a very real world after an event, what the event was and how it happened is totally up to you. The core book will cover three cities in North America, Seattle, Chicago and Denver with future sourcebooks covering the rest of the USA, the UK, Europe, Eastern Europe, China, Japan etc.
...
The District RPG currently uses a percentile mechanic this means that when you want your character to attempt a task you would roll under their attribute + Skill on a D100.
...

Welcome to The District and thanks for picking up this Quick-Start Guide, what we will try to do in very few pages is give you a brief overview of how the game plays, the rules and also a look at character creation.

boardgame.name: The District Character Templates
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A basic character sheet was included in The District Quick-Start Guide. In addition, four Character Templates (specialized character sheets) were provided to support specific character types:


The Feral
The Merc
The Rigger
The Scavenger

boardgame.name: Circadians: Chaos Order
Zirkadianer: Chaos-Ordnung
boardgame.description:
The initial quakes were only minor tremors, but as the land began to unravel, so did our sense of security. We watched the cliffs of Hytazch fall into the sea. Mighty trees of old, swallowed up by the caverns below. As the waters rose, a great roar was heard across the plains. This was no cry of disbelief or heartache, but of jubilance. Songs began to fill the air as our once peaceful hosts, now readied themselves for war. Suddenly on the horizon, what appeared as huge bolts of energy shoot out into the depths of space, before disappearing again. Despite the inevitable shock wave heading our way, the clans continued to cheer as they made haste towards the origin of the blaze. What could cause such elation? Why abandon caution in favour of chaos? Had we missed something - some crucial misunderstanding of this planet and its inhabitants? Upon reaching the site, we were immediately plunged into combat. Across the landscape lay six massive structures, towering over the forces fighting below. They seemed to pulse and flicker with a golden haze. Could these be the ancient relics the Oxataya spoke of? There is so much we still do not understand, but we cannot concede to indecision. Will we stay and fight, or retreat back to Moontide?

In Circadians: Chaos Order, players take on the role of 1 of 6 asymmetric factions. Each faction has their own means of winning the game, unique leaders, attribute cards and other abilities.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Betta
boardgame.description:
Today’s your first day of work at Bette’s Pets, everyone’s favorite pet shop. You were expecting to learn how to stock shelves and operate the till, but Bette bought a boatload of bettas. In order to boost sales, Bette’s come up with a way to make a game out of it, and she’s going to award points based on how well you follow her instructions.

You need to arrange the bettas in 3x3 displays. Customers are most drawn to 6 particular patterns. Use your arrangement ideas (your tiles) to make these patterns pop!

Plus, customers love seeing a lot of one color in a display. The more you fill a display with your color, the better your bettas are going to sell.

Once the displays have been filled, or everyone runs short of arrangement ideas, the task is done and whoever has the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Solar Sphere
boardgame.description:
The human race has exhausted all the energy available on planet Earth. If they are to advance into an intergalactic civilisation they must harness the power of a solar system. They must build a dyson sphere.

Solar Sphere is a dice placement/manipulation game with elements of engine building, resource management, and set collection. Set hundreds of years in the future in a time when competition will move mankind forward, but when collaboration is also sometimes necessary. In Solar Sphere, each player commands a mothership. Their primary task is to build a dyson sphere. But, with crew to hire and aliens attacking the sphere, there are many other ways to earn prestige and become the saviour of mankind.

In this dice placement game, players can manipulate their dice using drones. However, players have a limited supply of drones, which are also used to upgrade dice placement spots or to support in fights against aliens. Players can always recycle used drones to get them back into their supply. Or, spend them for instant benefits.

Players simultaneously start the turn by rolling their dice. Dice act as spacecraft and are sent, in payer order, to locations to gather resources, build the dyson sphere, build or recycle drones, upgrade worker spots, hire crew, and fight off aliens.

Crew come with their own unique benefits that will help players in a variety of areas. Chain crew abilities together to build a good engine, and retire them for extra benefits. Making space for new crew members.

As the game progresses, more aliens will arrive to defend a sun that they also need. Fight them off alone, or join forces with other players and share the rewards. However, if no one takes on the rebellious aliens, then you all lose points.

Solar Sphere combines a combination of mechanisms with a powerful theme to bring players an immersive experience.

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crawler: Scenario Packs
boardgame.description:
What ARE the Scenarios?

The Scenario Packs are 4 distinct and specific Events-based adventures of epic difficulty and challenge for the players. Not for the faint of heart. The Events can not really be used in a Standard game as they are very specific. Standard cards from your Delve or Expansion Packs are used to build the Dungeon decks and then the 10 Event and 1 Character from ONE Scenario are mixed with those cards to form the 80 card deck.

Fell the Colossus is a brutal challenge to destroy one of the rare Dreadlander Colossus constructs as it rumbles its way across the land. Billowing a cloud of smoke, it strides towards its intended target to deploy the army it holds within, to wreck havoc with its own powerful weapons, or even it's bare metal hands! To get in you must climb the legs, run up along the arms, or fight through the horde in its chest when it opens to ascend to the castle and defeat its pilot: a Doom Caster!

Hell Gate uncovers an evil cult within your own lands that seek to unleash a true horror from beyond! Will it be Abaddon, or another demon prince? There's no time to waste as you unmask their hidden members, seek out their lair and eventually break into their inner sanctum to put a stop to their evil plans! It's going to be an epic challenge as Dread Lord Vorlaat has come down from his tower at the Black Wall.

The Cursed tells of a land haunted by a horror, where the very members of someone's household may have become an infected terror that plagues the people. Locking themselves in, they pray for salvation, as the night brings unholy terror. The Vampiress features in this scenario, and she won't go easily as you face her Brood, discover her identity, and unravel her final resting place where she hangs between worlds.

Legendary Hoard is more of what you might expect from a typical adventure; find the map, get to the location, enter it's foul trap-laden tunnels, and find the treasure... however, this one is guarded by an Ancient Ruby Dragon! Nothing will be easy about this battle as the dragon introduces the new Attribute "Titan" outlined on the new Rule card card included in the box!

boardgame.name: Bluffaneer
boardgame.description:
Yarrr! Grab your most trusted crew and sail out to the high seas with Big G Creative’s newest release, Bluffaneer! This adventurous new dice game sets mates against each other as players try to pilfer pirate treasure and bluff their way to the largest stack of gold.

Bluffaneer is a game for sea dogs of all ages, whether it’s a family game session or you’re switching up poker night to work on your bluffing skills.

To play, players roll bone-shaped dice and bluff to steal coins from fellow mates, aiming to collect the most treasure in each round. But beware, mateys! You may have to cough up your gold coins if another clever pirate catches you in the bluff.

One game of Bluffaneer only takes about 15 minutes, so three to six pirates ages 10+ can enjoy a quick and rowdy romp or keep the pirate-themed fun going with multiple games to determine who is truly the craftiest Bluffaneer of all.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Amicus Curiae
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A brief dating brief pertaining to the legal profession
...
A legal-themed dating simulation in support of finding romance in unexpected places
...
Amicus Curiae is a tabletop game for 2-4 players, with a rotating GM role.

boardgame.name: White Girl Wasted
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

White people desperately want spirit animals.

There is some evidence in ancient European cultures for spirit animals: familiars, the Agathion, Germanic totems, and the fylgjur are all analogous to what modern-day whites call the spirit animal. However, these are often not cited in the new age books you’d find at your local Barnes and Noble. White people love “native traditions” and “Eastern mysticism” that give us a spirit animal, in the same way we love online quizzes that tell us what Disney characters we are.

This game is not about indigenous spiritual practices. This game is about giving privileged, naïve white people exactly what we want - a spiritual reflection of ourselves on a vision quest. That that spiritual reflection isn’t as sexy as a wolf or a fox, and also does not reflect the cultural suffering we do not have encoded in our blood and hearts?

Well, that’s something you might want to speak to a manager about.

boardgame.name: The Rite
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a SACRED MAIDEN in your village’s SPRING RITUAL. Tonight, one of you will become a SACRIFICE, chosen by FATE, dancing herself to death to bring the change of seasons.

boardgame.name: The Paradise Machine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Yesterday, gods ceased to walk the earth. Today, Elysium’s top scientists are unveiling their greatest triumph: a machine that allows you to create your idealized self.

This American Freeform LARP is an exploration of progress versus tradition.

boardgame.name: Gaudete Sunday
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Gaudete Sunday is a lighthearted, romantic game about social pressure, manners, mischief, and the possibilities of the Christmas Holiday. Every year on Gaudete Sunday, the third Sunday of Advent, the eponymous matron of Miss Clavier’s School opens her doors to Old World nobility and American mercantile barons alike, to show off the creme de la creme of her students. The Gaudete Sunday tea is the time for the students to meet some of the most eligible suitors Europe and North America have to offer--and, perhaps, if they’re very lucky, be courted themselves. Many a loyal husband and devoted wife have been educated at Miss Clavier’s School, and while they themselves might not be the richest of the rich, they have the education, manners, wit, and cunning to effortlessly fraternise with those at the top. To court or not--therein lies the question.

boardgame.name: Quilt of Shadows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The sun is dying out. It’s like a storm is coming, but slowly and constantly. Every day we wake up to a sunrise that is slightly dimmer than the last. We don’t know what mage cast a spell that went wrong, or which king angered which god, but we know that we’re marching inexorably towards an end … if not The End.

Quilt of Shadows is a Powered By The Apocalypse game about a medieval fantasy world where the sun is dying. In other games, you might play the brave heroes who venture to the edge of the horizon to save the Prime Material Plane or the center of the universe or even the sun itself. Here, you play the people who are suffering with the disappearances of their liege lords, in towns where survival is key over any heroic feat. You will not be playing great fighters or battle priests or powerful mages. Instead, you are the farmer in the valley who keeps your town fed, the cleric who keeps their spirits light, or the link who runs in-between hamlets on secret errands.

boardgame.name: The Emperor's Orchard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

They called the orchard I served in “The Emperor’s Harem” - and we were, in a sense.

The Emperor's Orchard is an American freeform LARP for at least 6 players. Play over five scenes, and wrestle with frustration, control, and revolution. Players may take on the roles of the Emperor, the Empress, their nobles, or the sentient trees living in the Emperor's orchard.

boardgame.name: Dreaming the Devil
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A terrible thing has happened in this village. Someone must be to blame.

Dreaming the Devil is an intense existential LARP about a 16th century witch trial in rural Italy.

boardgame.name: Uppers
boardgame.description:
Last Resort Island is a city consumed by desire - for those that live on the island, the greatest amusement is violence. A single person’s strength alone can build great fortune, and earn the admiration of the populace.

With strength, motivation and fire in their eyes, two young men, Ranma and Michiru, arrive at Last Resort Island to begin their quest, their sights aimed for the top - but they aren’t the only ones on Last Resort Island with lofty ambitions.

UPPERS tells the story of two men and their journey to the top, using 12 varied fighters and eight support characters - discover their drive, their heartbreaking backgrounds, and fight to be crowned the strongest in Last Resort Island!


UPPERS, a beat-em-up brawler originally released as a Japanese PlayStation®Vita exclusive, has been fully remastered for the PC. The game puts you in control of up to 13 fighters, including bonus character Daidoji-senpai of the SENRAN KAGURA series. Follow their journey through seven varied Chapters across multiple difficulty levels and a multitude of locations!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: HMS Ark Royal
boardgame.description:
One of the most famous carriers of the war, the HMS Ark Royal received many battle honours in its service.
The first enemy aircraft shot down by the Fleet Air Arm was with one of her Blackburn Skuas, while her bombers sank the German cruiser Königsberg, the first example of a capital ship being sunk by an attack from the air.

Better remembered is the Ark Royal’s role in the sinking of the Bismarck, where her Fairey Swordfish launched a torpedo attack that damaged its rudder, leaving it vulnerable to the rest of the fleet.

Other notable actions included convoys to Malta, the Norwegian campaign and involvement in the first U-boat kill of the war.

In 1941 she was struck by a torpedo and sank while under tow.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Tirpitz
boardgame.description:
Sister ship to the Bismarck, the Tirpitz was 2,000 tons heavier and thus the heaviest warship to have ever been produced by a European navy.
She served in Norway and the Baltic Fleet acting as a potent deterrent. The Tirpitz became an obsession for the British. After the sinking of the Bismarck, the Tirpitz, as Germany’s most powerful warship, was destined to spend much of the war in port.

After the daring St Nazaire raid by the British, it was deemed unfeasible to use Tirpitz against the Atlantic convoys of the Allies. Instead, she was used sparingly, as a deterrent against Allied invasion in Norway and to intercept Allied convoys to the Soviet Union. In September 1943, along with the battleship Scharnhorst, she bombarded Allied positions on Spitzbergen. This was the only occasion the mighty battleship fired her main battery in anger.

The relentless attacks of the British, would prove to be the end of the mighty vessel. They launched many raids on her; from mini-submarines and two full scale air raids. She was eventually  sunk in 1944 by Lancaster bombers armed with 12,000 lb Tallboy bombs.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Front on Frost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Leaders of the Ten-Towns have lost their patience with the antics of the Zhentarim in Targos. But giants have begun interfering in their leader’s plans. Can the adventurers find a solution?

A 2 or 4 Hour Adventure For 5th through 10th Level Characters

This adventure occurs in Bryn Shander and Targos, one of the Ten-Towns in Icewind Dale, and is based on the Out of the Woods hook from the Dungeoncraft program. Only Season 10 Characters may earn rewards from this adventure if following Adventurers League rules.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: A Hot Time in the Cold Town Tonight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Termalaine is experiencing a strangely warm day, with the temperature almost up to freezing, and its rivals want to know why. What secrets are behind this spell of mild weather?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This Dungeoncraft adventure is set in and near the Ten Towns village of Termalaine in the Icewind Dale and features


An abandoned gem mine
A forgotten dwarven outpost
An icebound merchant ship
A hidden wizard's tower
And more!


Maps and tokens for the Roll20 virtual tabletop are also included.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Something Sinister
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of kobold miners have uncovered something very unusual at the bottom of their mine. They need a band of brave adventurers to make sure that what they have found is not a risk to their health.

Are you brave enough to heed the call?

A two to four hour Plague of Ancients Dungeon Craft module for level 1-4 characters.

This module is a D&D Adventurers League Season 10 module, featuring cameos from the Oar's Rest series of adventures. It premieres on the Scandinavian online con, Conmar Yule Union 2021, Saturday January 9th, 2021.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Starmada
boardgame.description:
Starmada is a simple (but not simplistic) board game of starship combat, in which players square off in a general attempt to blast each other's fleets into just so much space junk.

While the universe of the Imperial Starmada and its major adversaries is fully detailed in the rulebook, Starmada is much more than just another game, tied down to its own background. Instead, Starmada can be played in just about any science fiction setting you can imagine. There are dozens of optional rules, exotic special equipment and menacing weapons that can be used or discarded at your discretion, to create the type of game you want to play!

boardgame.name: Twirling Towards Oblivion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Good Mead is going to elect a new town speaker. The two candidates are both well respected merchants and each other's business rivals. Chaos ensues when Mr. Simplesun, an eccentric old man known for telling tall tales, throws his hat into the race. He is claiming to know the horrible and disturbing truth about the two front-runners!

A 4-hour tier 1 adventure for 1st-4th level characters. Part of the Dungeoncraft Plague of Ancients campaign for Adventures League. Season 10. Based on the “A Dark Horse” Adventure Seed. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL of 3.

Includes image flies of the maps for VTT programs.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: First Time for Everything
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Amidst Auril’s eternal darkness and growing unrest in the Ten Towns, adventurers delve into the frozen earth in pursuit of small-time thieves. But what started as a simple retrieval mission quickly escalates, as unexpected magic thwarts their pursuit. As shadows of the past coalesce and present threats leap into the looming future, adventurers fight against the ravages of time itself to catch yesterday’s culprits and thwart tomorrow’s villains.

A Four-Hour adventure for Tier 1 Characters (Levels 1-4). Optimized for APL 3.

Included is a full-color PDF, printer-friendly PDF, gridded DM area map, and player-facing area map (gridless- appropriate for online play).

Part 1 of the Kobolds Through Time Trilogy
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Banished Thane
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A recent avalanche in the Spine of the World has revealed a mountainside entrance of worked stone. Halena Ironstone believes it could be the tomb of her ancestor, Daglund the Banished, and she needs brave adventurers to investigate.

TOMB OF THE BANISHED THANE is a 4-hour Adventurers League Plague of Ancients adventure set in the Icewind Dale region of the Forgotten Realms. The adventure is designed for a party of five 3rd-level characters, but it contains sidebars to help you scale the difficulty for parties with more or less characters of differing levels.

This adventure includes:


A 16-page color adventure with an easy-to-follow encounter format
Battlemaps in JPG format for use with virtual tabletop software
Fantasy Grounds module file with maps and monster tokens


Note: Tomb of the Banished Thane uses the "Breaking Ice-olation" Plague of Ancients adventure seed.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Are You Open-minded?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crime has increased in the town of Easthaven, a group of kobolds who are normally docile are now stealing from the defenseless civilians

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: 100 Reasons to be Committed in the 19th Century - Vol 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

People were committed to Insane Asylums for a variety of mental, physical and social reasons. Whether they were committed to contain a disease, hide socially embarrassing behavior, to gain an inheritance, end a marriage, hide an accusation or address a true mental disease or limitation, everyone was committed for a (often strange) reason.

This list is intended for any 19th century to late 1920s campaigns (like Call of Cthulhu, Gangbusters, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.) where reform from social planning and psychology was starting to address issues of sickness, poverty, and mental illness. Any reasons with a “*” are intended for women only.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Media's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Media is a slang term for the journalists, mavericks, and communicators that command the attention of the masses, as they try to alter or stop the messages that governments, criminals, and corporations are spreading. Whether corporate owned or freelance, these leaders can have military grade training and cyber augmentation to help them find the truth no matter where it’s hidden.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk Red, Cyberpunk 2020, Carbon 2185, Axon Punk, etc.) where technology is running rampant, and brutal corporations and other dark forces are trying to hide the truth. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways for a referee to add a new dimension to the next hard-hitting reporter.

boardgame.name: 30 Kinds of Weather in Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This roleplaying tool is intended to give Dark Future settings (like Cyberpunk 2020, Cyberpunk Red, Carbon 2185, Aeon Punk, GURPS Cyberpunk, etc.) that moody, film noir feel without a constant and unrealistic result of “rain”.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in a Cyberpsycho's Lair - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Every punk knows that when you become too dangerous, you’ll be regarded as a threat to those in power (like the police, or the military or the mob), or some misguided vigilante with an overdeveloped sense of altruism. The only way to live with those kinds of threats is to find and build a place where you are protected. Someplace where you can start your war with careful strategy and an ever-increasing stockpile of weapons. Someplace where you can have your visions, memories and even obsessions without fear of intrusion or violation.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (Cyberpunk Red, Cyberpunk 2020, Carbon 2185, Axon Punk, Android, etc.) where mad cyborgs run rampant in an urban battleground. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add new creative dimensions and roleplaying elements to the lair of a public enemy.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Black Sea Adventure Area 1: Beneath the Old Cairn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Old Cairn could be located anywhere in your campaign. The cairn is a mound with a set of ancient Pictish standing stones, coloured red and black. The Picts of the local area have forgotten who was buried in the mound and who erected the stones. No writing of any kind is on the surface. The stonework is old Pictish in nature with very simple splits to the stone with no polish or carving.

boardgame.name: Sanctuary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Does the party need a base in order to store items, rest, or fend off hordes of chasing goblins? Sanctuary is a collection of tables, base plans and lore to be used as homes for parties of adventurers!

Each of the unique abodes comes with a backstory, timeline, map and internal layout. There are also eight D20 tables for unique concepts and designs surrounding a base, so the residence can be outfitted in a way that best suits your players!

These humble abodes can be won in tournaments, cleared of monsters and redecorated, purchased for a hefty sack of gold, or simply taken by force!

boardgame.name: Hex-Worlds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hex-Worlds contains a Hex Map grid, a D20 Hex Icon and table page for random world generation, black and white icons, coloured icons (which can be printed on card and cut out as tiles), and a Hex-World example map called 'Land of Herne, the Hunter's Wild'. The Land of Herne Hex World also comes with flavour text, fleshing out the more prominent locations.

Grab your D20 and your D6, and generate a vast world in minutes!

boardgame.name: Roadside Events
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

System Neutral Encounter Concepts and Tables!

When traversing the pathways of the over-world, parties need to experience surprises and events, just as they would when delving into in a dark dungeon. ‘Realm Fables: Roadside Events’ contains a series of events that focus on moral conundrums and the outcomes of making poor or rash decisions. These outcomes can be anything from taking damage, finding loot or experiencing simple story beats that make a character carry guilt with them, or gain a continual consequence, for a long time. Events laid out here contain possible choices the party may make, and lists the consequences of those choices. The Roadside Events are starting points for interesting encounters, but as we all know, the players can make decisions the DM never saw coming! The aim of these events are to aid the DM, and cover the more probable ground. Encounters while travelling can be so much more than a group of bandits waiting to jump out as you pass! What if those bandits are starving, and have children in a nearby village with failing crops?

The morality of situations on the road should be considered, and Roadside Events also contains gruelling encounter consequences that contain zero positive outcomes. These tables can be rolled on to spark the imagination of the DM when a lull may strike in the creation of over-world travel, and build encounters that will not easily be forgotten.

boardgame.name: Dungeon: Despoiler of the Dead
boardgame.description:
A System Neutral Dungeon!

Publisher's blurb:

Some call them fanatics, others call them heroes. Birthed upon the black sands, beneath the half moon, to the great nomadic people of the Sallow Kingdom, Despoilers have a deep faith few can fathom. They wander the deserts beneath the raging sun in prayer, wishing to please their chosen God, and what better way to please the almighty pantheon than to slay the corrupted dead? And now a new tomb has been discovered, deep in the desert, ready to be despoiled...


Dungeon backstory
Dungeon Map
Room details

boardgame.name: Burger Builder
boardgame.description:
Don your chef hats and prepare for a patty-flipping, cheese-melting, sauce-squeezing battle for burger supremacy.

In this fun and fast-paced card game, players score points by using colourful ingredient cards to assemble tasty items off the Burger Builder menu.

First, players draw 7 cards from the deck. At the start of their turn, players can ask other players for any ingredient card they may need, depending on what want to build. If the other player has one or more of that ingredient, they must hand one over. If not, the player whose turn it is draws 2 cards from the deck instead. They can then use the cards they have in their hand to create as many items off the Burger Builder menu as possible.

Each ingredient card can be used in a variety of meals, allowing players to be strategic in what they build and when. You could play something small, like onion rings or potato cakes, or save up your cards to build something big, like an epic burger!

A variety of power cards let you play more strategically in your race to accumulate the most points. Swap out cards from your hand, force other players to throw away their ingredient cards or even steal finished menu items. But be careful, your opponents are out to do the same to you in return. Power cards can be used at any time on your turn.

If a player uses up all the cards in their hand they get to draw another 7 cards from the deck. However, this ends their turn and they cannot play any more cards.

Play ends in one of two ways. In sprint mode, play ends when the first player reaches 30 points. In marathon mode, play continues until the entire deck has been used up and players can no longer create any food combos. The winning player is the one who has played the most ingredient cards.

And that's all there is to it!

boardgame.name: Sáltame Si Puedes
boardgame.description:
It is the game in which the frog with the best memory will be the winner. Jump your opponents and steal their flies to be the winner!

It won't be easy work! Since you will have to remember where the figures are under the cards in order to advance.

It's a fun game for the whole family, where even your older brother could win!

Preparation: We place all the chips face down in the center. And around in a shape of a circle all the tiles. All players place their frog at one end of the circle.

How to play: In your turn you must turn a chip of the center to see if it is the same insect than the next insect on your way, if so; you advance to that square, and you try again by turning another chip to see if it is the same insect than the next insect on your way.

If you reach to a space where there is another frog from another player, you will eat that frog and that player will be out for the rest of the game.

When the insect on the card does not coincide with the next inscet on your way, you must turn over all the visible insect cards and it will be the next player's turn.

The player who eats all the other frogs wins the game.

Contents: 1 template with 24 circular aquatic leaf cards, 12 octagonal cards to peel off, 1 template with 8 adhesive labels of frogs to stick, 4 player tokens, 4 cards (Flies) and 1 rulebook.

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 1 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia

Premier Issue

January 2021

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Playmat
boardgame.description: Two versions themed after the expansion sets. Cloth front, neoprene back,Size is 16" x 20" x 2mm.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 1

boardgame.name: Shards of the Exalted Dream: Burn Legend
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Perhaps in some far-flung dream of glory, there was once a world in which the greatest champions were chosen by the fickle, yet eternal blessings of the celestial forces above them. Perhaps they were defined by a great struggle against worldmaking titans, whose dying curses doomed them to hubris.

This is not that world. Though suffused with divine life energy and wills of their own, the sun and earth are distant and inscrutable celestial bodies, not deities.

boardgame.name: Heaven's Reach
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the Central Empire, where mankind is ruled over by interstellar trading clans, transgalactic cartels and stranger syndicates-all of whom are overseen by the Thousandth Dynasty, the ruling bureaucracy overseen by Heaven’s Son, His Divine Lunar Presence. Chosen of the Moon, betrayer of his Solar bride and eternal overseer of an empire whose thousand star systems are but a shadow of what they once stood for.

Ten Million Dragons serve his every whim. The Grand Celestial Mountain, a subspatial virtual universe whose roots pierce the real world to create an Essence-fuelled infosphere, stands as shelter to his loyal Sidereal Exalted that tend it’s archives and impossible computing processes. And it is his will that mankind and only mankind stand in prominence within the empire’s history of human ascendance, despite the near-constant interactions between the countless alien races among the stars.

User summary:

A large number of minor revisions of this scenario exist.

boardgame.name: Unknown Armies
boardgame.description:
Jump through a world of secret weirdness and postmodern magick

From the introduction:

You are about to enter a world much like your own: same history, same major figures, same ordinary, structured, boring universe… or is it? The truth is that this reality is frayed at the edges, shoddily constructed and full of holes. A few people, those (un)lucky enough to learn about this weirdness, often begin to see their lives and the universe in completely different ways, and either learn to exploit it or die painfully.

What a lot of people struggle to understand is that the cosmos revolves almost entirely around humanity: humans are the ones who define the laws of nature, not the other way around, and the most important facets of human nature, when flawlessly exemplified by an individual, ascend to a higher state of being, aptly called “The Statosphere” by those in the know.

boardgame.name: Enchanters: Deluxe Storage Box
boardgame.description: The ultimate storage solution for everything Enchanters! Will fit all Kingdom cards, Village cards, Overlord cards, Would cards, Quest cards, Mythic cards, fully sleeved or not plus all tokens and extra elements in a solid plastic tray.

boardgame.name: Enchanters: Crystal Shards Set
boardgame.description:
Crystal Shards set contains:
30 plastic green crystals
15 plastic blue crystals
10 plastic yellow crystals

boardgame.name: Enchanters: Neoprene Kit
boardgame.description: Deluxe full colour Playmat + Four individual Player mats. All mats are high quality Neoprene, stitched for an optimal durability and comfort.

boardgame.name: Red fortryllersken
Rescue the Enchanter
boardgame.description:
Explore vast and exotic worlds

Our longest game yet! Tons of animations, clues, puzzles, and tools to pick up. Even a new fast travel feature added to the in-game map.

Continue the adventure of The Enchanted Books in this much longer point-and-click style puzzle adventure game. Search for the enchanter who has been trapped for years within the enchanted world of the last book you discovered! Find clues, solve puzzles, and uncover tools along the way needed to unlock and explore vast, exotic worlds and rescue the enchanter.

Uncle Henry has started to search for the enchanter within the book, but was unsuccessful so he is leaving this important task to you. He left clues in the enchanted world within the book to help you on your journey.

Your Uncle Henry has been renowned for discovering lost treasures for as long as you can remember. His legendary stories of adventure excited your imagination as you were a child growing up. Now with your newly acquired archeology skills, he has been reaching out from time to time for your help in tracking down some of these difficult to find treasures.

This captivating adventure game has:

Custom designed beautiful HD graphics!
Custom composed soundtrack and sound effects!
A built-in hint system for when you get stumped
A dynamic map to show the screens you have visited and current location
Fast travel within the in-game map
A camera that takes photos of clues and symbols as you discover them
Dozens of puzzles, clues, and items
Auto saves your progress
Available for phones and tablets!

Game Support

Hints and walkthrough videos for each step and puzzle are available inside the game as in-app purchase.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Red Woods: Awakening
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Play as Clair and Harry Mills - daughter and father: Claire is a collage student who wake up in an abandoned fallout shelter after a car crash - and her father try to look for her as she didn't came...

boardgame.name: Historia Battels 2: Res Militaria
Res Militaria Rome
boardgame.description:
Historia Battles series has been improved, in order to keep turn based game mechanic and most requested features, having a more charming and modern user interface.
I have fully rewritten my previous wargame (based on java + LibGdx technology and static sprites) using Godot and blender for unit graphic and animations.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Retro Football Management
Retro Football Management - Be a Football Manager
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Retro Football Management the game that brings the past to life. In this classic football manager game you will be able to take control of the greatest sides from history and complete a season in less time than it takes to complete your daily commute.

What are you waiting for, download the game now and take a nostalgic trip through the history of gaming and football!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Slice Fractions 2
boardgame.description:
The sequel to Slice Fractions, the acclaimed and multi award-winning game – Best of 2014 and Editor’s choice of the Apple Store.

An adventure that reveals the mysteries of fractions! Help Mammoth get his stolen hat back with the help of new creatures that move, multiply and reveal hidden fractions.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Solitaire
Solitaire (Patience)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Implementation of the classic solitaire card game.

boardgame.name: Somewhere - The Vault Papers
Somewhere: The Vault Papers
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Description
Somewhere is a real time interactive fiction where you are _not_ the hero.
Make the right choices and help Cat to investigate and stay alive.
You receive notifications on your mobile device while Cat pushes further her investigation: answer now or when you are available.
Somewhere is a branched story where your choices will have consequences.

History
Cat is a journalist. She has been contacted by a whistleblower who gave her very compromising materials on a multinational company.
The case is way too big than what she expected and she quickly gets overwhelmed by the scope of what she discovers.
She gets chased, her life is being threatened and now she has no other choice than trying to break the scandal.
Now, you are the only person that Cat can trust.
Somewhere is a deeply immersive story about survival and tenacity, with several different endings. Cat counts on YOU.

boardgame.name: Sprichst Du Englisch?
boardgame.description:
A Tiptoi game to learn English

Explore the town with Amy, Susan, Mike, and Fred.

The Tiptoi pen names objects or phrases common sentences in English and the players find these either on the town map or on picture/Word cards.

The player who gets the most correct answers wins.

There are three different difficulty settings and a Tiptoi pen is required for the game

boardgame.name: Star Diffusion
星際擴散
boardgame.description:
《Star Diffusion》is a top-down view sci-fi horror game.
Raynord requests for docking at Planet Xeno after him complete a mission, but the answer he gets is nothing but silence.
Raynord lands at the star port, then he finds out the port is not only in dark but also massive dead bodies of port staff...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Stone Of Souls
Stone Of Souls HD
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Inside an old and mysterious castle - among the stench of death you try to find the sinister Stone of Souls and stop the evil necromancer and his sinister monsters roaming the castle halls...

boardgame.name: Stone Of Souls 2: Stone Parts
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Continuation of the story of Stone Of Souls and the hunt for the necromancer.

boardgame.name: Targi: Alternative Border Cards
boardgame.description:
Mini-expansion containing six (now 12) border cards with alternative rules, replacing the Noble, Trader, Fata Morgana, Silversmith, Caravan and Tribal Expansion cards.

I added the new files with all 12 cards in English and German here in the files section.

Hope you enjoy them.
Andy

boardgame.name: Sudoku [Dronzer]
Sudoku {Premium Pro}
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Sudoku game from Dronzer Developers.

boardgame.name: Sudoku Pro
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Implementation of Sudoku made by Lebanese developer ProGo

boardgame.name: Tabou Stories: Love Episodes
boardgame.description:
Have you ever imagined yourself as the main character in your favorite romantic movie? Tabou Stories lets you do just that! Make choices that matter – wear beautiful outfits, navigate the drama and fall in love. In Tabou, you make your secret dreams come true!

• Customize your avatar – you choose what you want to look like

• Wear the outfit you like best from a wide variety of choices

• Develop relationships with other characters in the story – will you be friends, enemies or lovers?

• Make choices that will affect the ending of the story – you are the master of your destiny!
Flirt with celebrities, become famous, and find your perfect match in Matchmaker! In an unexpected turn of events, you’ve ended up on a famous reality show. With contestants including a bad-boy singer, a famous Hollywood actor, and your model ex, things are about to get interesting! Are you going to be a flirt that wraps everyone around her finger to win the show, or are you looking for true love? Are you a good girl or a scandal queen? YOU choose what you want to do!

In Billionaire’s Darling , you are a normal college girl until you meet billionaire Henry Lockwood. You get an offer to be his fake girlfriend… an offer that sounds too good to be true. Henry is a complicated man and his family is full of secrets… Can you find out the truth? Are his feelings for you real, or is it all just for show? Take part in high society, wear expensive outfits, experience thrilling moments and uncover mysteries, all in one story!

Your new boss is arrogant, but incredibly handsome and charming. How long until the sparks start flying? Find out in Office Affair! Can you keep things professional? Are you going to focus on your law career, or on your gorgeous boss? Or maybe it’s your kind- hearted client who caught your eye instead? It’s your choice! Be a lawyer superstar, fight for justice, help people, and maybe even find your happy ending!

And that’s just the beginning! We are constantly working to bring you new and exciting stories. Whichever story you choose, hours of fun are guaranteed! Download Tabou Stories now, and start living your secret life!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 9 Years of Shadows
boardgame.description:
In a land where a dark curse has consumed all color, an abandoned orphanage hides a terrible secret. After 9 years of living in the shadows, a brave warrior will rise: Europa. A battle hardened maiden who carries the fate of the world on her shoulders.

Equipped with little else than her parent’s mementos, her task is daunting - venture inside the missing orphan’s memories to vanquish the curse that has been tormenting the people, and restore peace to the lands.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Killing Cards: Mafia
boardgame.description:
Only One Will Survive.

The godfather of the mafia has just died. You are one of the suitors for his succession. The period is troubled: a Vigilante is on the prowl and each suitor is getting ready to hire Henchmen to get rid of his competitors. Your goal is to be the last player left alive.

On your turn, you will play cards and then draw one. If the card you draw is the Vigilante or a Henchman, either you have a Bodyguard and he protects you, or you die. All the other cards are there to help you hire Henchmen or avoid drawing a card that would kill you.

boardgame.name: Tempura of the Dead
boardgame.description: An 8-bit video game for the xbox 360

boardgame.name: Kishin Hishou Demonbane
boardgame.description: Kurou and Al, who crushed the conspiracy of Jashin with Demonbane, are working as detectives in a reborn world. However, there comes another shadow looming toward them. Many mysterious cases... by "Bloody Monsters". A fluid mass of blood destroys the whole town. Kurou and Al are busy with solving mysterious cases. At the same time, mysterious people appear in front of them, one is a girl in a red dress and another one is a boy named "Nitouryu". Who are they? Are they concerned with these mysterious cases?

boardgame.name: "Hello, world."
boardgame.description:
The main character, Kazuki Tomonaga, is a robot and has no emotions. The purpose is to learn that of human beings through experience and learning, and the process is an important essence of the scenario.

The average play time of one lap reaches 30 hours or more, which is the longest among Nitroplus works, and it is far behind " Demonbane ". This hasn't been broken yet. A wealth of resources such as the number of backgrounds and objects drawn in 3D are also invested.

This is the first work in which Gen Urobuchi is not very involved in the production (I have come up with the idea of ​​making the main character a robot).

Source: Wikipedia, "[ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%22Hello%2C_world.%22 "Hello, world."]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Gard
boardgame.description:
Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Gard lets you become the best guide in the "Gard" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

Take a coach trip through the Gard department and answer questions,
For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
The winner is the first guide to be back

boardgame.name: Loading
boardgame.description:
In Loading, all the players try simultaneously to collect as many progression points as possible. Who will be the fastest...or the wisest?

All players but one start with a deck of cards in hand; the final player waits, hand outstretched, for another player to hand them a deck. As soon as you have a deck, examine it as quickly or as thoroughly as you wish for a progression card to play on your stack. You must play cards in ascending order, but you need not play them sequentially. Once you've played a card, get rid of the deck by placing it in the hand of whoever waits.

Once you've gathered enough progression points — or at least once you think you're in a good position — you can discard the deck instead of giving it to someone else, then take a bonus STOP card. There aren't enough STOP cards for all players, so don't delay too long.

Loading includes a two-player mode, as well as an expert mode for skilled players.

•••

Dans Loading, tous les joueurs essayent, en même temps, de collecter un maximum de points de progression. Qui sera le plus rapide... ou le plus malin ?

Un jeu de Draft en temps réel, sans aucun tours!
Tous les joueurs, sauf un, commencent avec un Deck de cartes. Le dernier attend, la main tendue, qu'un autre joueur lui donne un Deck.

Dès que vous avez la main sur un Deck, fouillez (rapidement) dans le Deck pour trouver une carte de progression à jouer sur votre Pile. Les cartes doivent être jouées dans l'ordre croissant, mais pas nécessairement avec la carte juste au dessus (on peut jouer un 19 ou un 47 sur un 18, mais pas un 14).
Une fois que vous avez joué une carte, débarrassez-vous (rapidement) du Deck en le donnant au joueur qui en attend un.

Une fois que vous avez accumulé suffisamment de points de progression (ou du moins lorsque vous le pensez...), vous pouvez vous débarrasser du Deck au lieu de le donner et prendre une carte Stop de bonus de fin.

Soyez rapide, il n'y aura pas de cartes Stop pour tout le monde...

Pour les plus aguerris d'entre vous, vous trouverez également une variante pour joueurs confirmés et une variante pour 2 joueurs.

-description from publisher (French)

boardgame.name: Meow Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Meow Mayhem is a fast paced game where, as a cat, you must gain a Reputation among your cat peers by committing bad acts! It can be played with 3-6 players, and games last 20-60 minutes each. This is a puurrrrrfect game to play for people who love kitties or being mischievous!

This game is a new take on everyone's favorite thing: cats. The game's vivid illustrations of naughty cats paired with flavor text describing a Cat's point of view is pure and delightful fun. Although Meow Mayhem is a game for All Ages (in the sense that there is no cursing or overtly cruel humor),--the age recommendation is 10+. Players will need strong problem solving-skills, and there are small pieces which are legally a choking hazard for children 9 and younger. That said, cat lovers of ALL AGES will enjoy playing or watching this game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Moon Base Command
boardgame.description:
The Federation has issued a CRITICAL RED ALERT to Moon Base Command to prepare for a massive asteroid assault. You as the base commander must operate the protection system and take control of the missiles and two Plasma cannons. Each Plasma cannon has a limited firing capacity, a max range and an overheating protection system. The Federation has explained that it looks as if there will be [5] waves consisting of groups of asteroids heading towards the Moon base with four waves of asteroids per group. Each asteroid will be represented by a d6 die. You must protect the moon base and keep each of the three bases from being destroyed.

Victory conditions:
Your goal is to protect the Moon base at all costs. You must save at least 1 base with a shield value of at least one. A total victory would be all bases saved with full shield values of six each.

IKHON is a mysterious box. A gaol (jail) keeping four almost-forgotten folk gods at bay; the Bilkherd, the Becklure, the Old Dead and the dreaded Silkfiend. boardgame.name: 盤上決戦 (SSSS.GRIDMAN)
boardgame.description:
Board game based on the hit 2018 anime SSSS.GRIDMAN. Players play as Yuta Hibiki and the Gridman Alliance fighting against the kaiju created by Akane Shinjo in this cooperative dice game.

Players select a character from the show (Yuta, Utsumi, Rikka, Samurai Caliber, Max, Borr, or Vit) to move around the city and fight the kaiju that appear. However, you can't fend off against stronger kaiju alone. Ask a friend to join you in combat for a huge power boost. Work together to take down the final boss, Alexis Kerib!

Event cards in the game feature scenes from the source material, such as the dinner with Alexis and the meeting with the kaiju girl, and whenever Akane happens to move to the same space Yuto is on, his HP will immediately suffer. Guaranteed laughs for fans of the show.

Supports up to 4 players, including a solo mode where you control 4 characters.


2018年秋にアニメ化されて以来、いまだ根強い人気のアニメ『SSSS.GRIDMAN』（グリッドマン）がボードゲームで登場。
本商品は、プレイヤーが響裕太たち「グリッドマン同盟」の一員となり、新条アカネの生み出す怪獣たちと戦う、ダイスを使った協力型ゲームです。

プレイヤーはTVアニメの登場人物（裕太、内海、六花、サムライ・キャリバー、マックス、ボラー、ヴィット）から選び、街に現れる怪獣と戦います。しかし強力な怪獣は1人だけでは倒せません。他のプレイヤーと一致団結して戦うことで攻撃力は大きくアップします。仲間たちと話し合い、協力して最終ボス・アレクシスを倒しましょう！

ゲーム中のイベントでは、アニメの作中で話題となったエピソードを元にした「アレクシスと遭遇」や、「怪獣少女と遭遇」があったり、アカネの駒が裕太の駒と同じ場所に移動すると裕太のHPが減ったりなど、アニメを観ていた人なら思わず笑ってしまう内容が盛りだくさんです。

プレイ人数は4人までですが、1人だけでプレイすることも可能です（その場合は1人で4キャラクターを操ります）。

boardgame.name: At Dead of Night
boardgame.description:
At Dead Of Night is a horror game set in an old hotel, situated on a remote headland. When a group of students find themselves lost one night, they decide to book in.

There they meet Jimmy Hall, the creepy landlord, who invites them to watch his late night comedy show.

However, when Maya, the last student to arrive, turns him down, Jimmy's rage releases his psychopathic comedy alter-ego, Hugo Punch, who takes control.

Late that night Maya is woken by the scream of one of her friends somewhere in the hotel. Realising they're all in danger, Maya attempts to rescue her friends, but soon realises that there is more to this hotel than meets the eye.

To save her friends, she will have to confront and communicate with the ghosts of Jimmy's past and uncover his terrifying secret.

Source: The Developer Website.
