boardgame.name: This Game Is... Beyond Words
boardgame.description: A competitive Scrabble-esque word game for two players or teams. Players take turns being the "forming" and "defending" side over four rounds. Each round the forming player randomly draws letter tiles one at a time and places them on the grid starting from the center. Each new letter played must either form a complete word, or marked with one of ten pawns as an incomplete word. Each incomplete word must have a possible word declared for the unused letters. After every five letters played the defending player has a blocking tile available to prevent progress of the forming team. Each forming phase ends when the forming player either plays a complete word that uses a corner space, or gets three strikes. Strikes are accumulated for being unable to play a tile, declaring a word that would not fit in the area, or playing an illegal or false word. After each phase, players score points for each letter used in complete words only, and possibly double their score if they end on a corner that corresponds to the round being played.

boardgame.name: L'Éducation au fil de l'eau
boardgame.description:
L’Éducation au fil de l’eau educates young and old alike about water, land, biodiversity and life skills through its educational booklet.

Goals:

Be the first to finish the course
Enrich your knowledge
Open oneself to the world


Players progress on the board by rolling the dice and answering questions on Four themes, different issues:

WATER
Become aware of the importance of drinking clean water, understand where the water comes from, how and why it is made drinkable
Informing about inequalities in access to water in the world
Learn more about the water cycle and the physical states of water

EARTH
Discover the world geography and the city of Nantes, its history and its monuments
Become aware of the distribution of the world population,
Become aware of global warming and its impact

BIODIVERSITY
Discover permaculture, how it works and its benefits
Explain the importance of trees in the balance of our ecosystem, understand the need to reforest the planet
Become aware of the main causes of pollution

KNOW-BEING
Acquire good gestures to respect the environment (selective sorting, recycling, renewable energies, energy savings)
Discover emotions, become aware of the important values ​​for relationships with others
Raise awareness of the rights of the child and abuse



—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon: Battle Scenarios Volume #1
boardgame.description:
Scenarios and corresponding army lists for Warfare in the Age of Napoleon

Scenarios are:

Fleuros 1794.
Haslach 1805.
Saafeld 1806.
Hoff 1807.
Raab 1809.
Busaco 1810.
Albura 1811.
Borodino 1812 (4):
Shevardino Redoubt.
Davout's infantry attack on the fleches.
Cavalry attack on the fletches.
Great Redoubt.



Color battlefield maps.

—description from the publisher


With the success of Tod Kershner's Warfare in the Age of Napoleon rules, it has been requested that more be added to the basic game. As you know the basic game is the core of the system which deals with the armies of the Waterloo campaign. To use these scenarios, it is recommended that Warfare in the Age of Napoleon be used. The scenarios will be more adaptable to other battalion level rule systems, too. This supplement will encompass more areas of the Napoleonic period and include new unit types, special rules, and army lists. It will be formatted in a similar fashion as the AOM rulebook scenarios.

The Napoleonic era spans a stretch of time of continuous warfare from 1789 to 1825 (if including the wars of liberation in South America). The scenarios will be battles or parts of battles of selected years of the period.

Let's take a scenario/battle from the 1806 campaign of the French invasion of Prussia: Battle of Saalfeld, where a fast-moving French force runs into a Prussian/Saxon rearguard. The scenario will have a short description of the battle, a color map with deployment, and an order of battle. Included with be army lists specific to the battle and any special rules needed for the scenario. In addition, the army list will often include additional troop types not needed in the scenario so one has the means to do other battles of that campaign.

Many of the battles will be familiar to readers and gamers. The ordes of battle will be as accurate as possible, but note that some 'artistic license' is used in some situations. Many sources are available to the reader and the author does not attempt to be an authority on each battle. A bibliography of sources will be included.

With the addition of this supplement, it is hoped you can enjoy this period and its many fascinating campaigns and battle from the Age of Napoleon. Special thanks to Maurizio Bragaglia and David Webster.

—Description from Dale Wood, 2010
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon

boardgame.name: Read Between The Wines!
boardgame.description:
Forget what the bottle says, Read Between The Wines inspires players to write their own creative descriptions with the help of 54 theme cards like, "If this wine had a job, what would it do?" or "Compare this wine to a celebrity." No formal wine knowledge needed - it's full-bodied fun for everyone, from the seasoned connoisseur to the unripened amateur. Your next party or wine-tasting will be ABUZZ with laughter.

RBTW is best played with 4+ people and a 4 different wine samples. Each round introduces a new wine and a new theme card. Players sample the wine & write down their answer to the theme. The wine waiter of the round then reads them all aloud (with Shakesperean drama!) and each player gets one vote for their favorite answer. Each vote equals a point for the player who wrote it!

Play until the wine or creative juices run out... the player wtih the most points at the end of the game is deemed winner and MASTER CONNOISSEUR!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bad Boss 2
boardgame.description:
Bad Boss 2: It is the Arses that get ahead! A humorous card game that requires you to be an Arse to win! Collect more office characters than your opponents and avoid being stuck with the dreaded Bad Boss.

The deck has 3 types of cards - Character cards which players try to pair and accumulate as many as they can, Arse cards which players use to sabotage others or to get ahead; and the Bad Boss card which everyone tries to avoid.

The goal is to collect as many pairs as possible while avoiding the Bad Boss card by using Arse cards to your advantage. There are 9 different types of Arse cards like Arse kisser, Lazy Arse and Smelly Arse which makes getting ahead of others hilariously funny.

The player that is stuck with the Bad Boss card when all the cards are players will be the loser and the player with the most pairs is declared the winner.

-description from publisher

listing.notes: Worldwide registered mail delivery (with tracking code) in a bubble packed envelope.

boardgame.name: Domesday Manor Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

In 1086 a huge part of the populace of England live in small rural villages, each part of a Manor "owned" by a Knight, Baron or great Lord. Although the life of a Peasant is hard, becoming the Lord of the Manor promises relative luxury!

This book provides the rules and setting information to allow a character to run their own Manor, organise their own villagers and still find time to investigate supernatural goings on!

Rules for generation Manor stats, working out annual profit and loss, improvements, detailing villagers and hiring specialist is all here!

This book requires the Maelstrom Domesday RPG core book.

boardgame.name: Combat de Coqs
boardgame.description:
Combat de Coqs is the benchmark for French culture!

1320 questions divided into 12 categories (Music, Cinema, Sport, Media, Fashion, Gastronomy, History, Geography, French language, Literature, Economy, Art)
There are questions about the great classics, but also questions about current affairs.

This game will perfectly accompany your evenings with friends, or your Sundays with family.

Goal:
be the first player to validate each of the 12 categories by correctly answering the questions.

Gameplay:

roll the dice
choose one of the 2 themes indicated by the dice
answer the question of the chosen category
Correct answer: validate the category and re-roll the dice
Wrong answer: pass the dice to the next player



If the dice indicate 2 categories already validated, answer the chosen question correctly to be able to re-roll the dice.

boardgame.name: Jeu de la Mayenne
boardgame.description:
Jeu de la Mayenne is a board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos also with charades and riddles, which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the department of Mayenne.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among many, La Gravelle, Vaiges, Argentré, Changé, Saint-Jean-sur-Erve...
Travel through the territory and answer questions on different themes.
If the answer is correct, you can play again.

To win, collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

boardgame.name: 9DKP: Booster Pack
9DKP: Kat Deck
9DKP: Series 1
DKP: Zombie Deck
Survivor Deck
boardgame.description:
9DKP is a Trading Card Game (TCG) for 2 players, that takes place in the 9DKP universe that was created by world famous, toy designer Erick Scarecrow.

9DKP eschews complex rules for a lighter, faster game that still provides players with the fun and depth found in other TCGs. This Streamlined game play makes 9DKP the perfect game for players new to the genre, or for masters looking for something new.

With hundreds of cards to choose from, 9DKP: The TCG gives players nearly an infinite amount of choices when it comes to building their decks. Fill out your ranks with Character cards that generate DKP and offer special abilities. Think strategically and pair Characters with unique abilities to make powerful combos, or fill out your deck with Characters that quickly and consistently fill your DKP bank!

Spend your amassed DKP to use powerful Skratch cards that can cause game-changing results, or use it to put into play rare and powerful Character cards that can annihilate your opponent!"

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Divinity: Original Sin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rivellon, a world once ruled by the great Dragon Knights in a past so long ago that even the most well cared for histories have been corrupted and polluted to the point they are fairy tales at best. But Empires, even those watched over the the noblest of were-dragons, always fall in the end. Chaos ensues, someone else seizes the reins of power, and people do their best to move on and live as best they can.

boardgame.name: Danny Phantom: Urban Jungle
boardgame.description: Danny Phantom: Urban Jungle is a video game for the Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS handhelds. It is based on the episode "Urban Jungle" from the television series Danny Phantom and is the second video game for the series (the first is Danny Phantom: The Ultimate Enemy for the Game Boy Advance). Players play the role of Danny Phantom in his adventure to save Amity Park from various ghosts from the show. Its console versions were all cancelled for unknown reasons.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition

boardgame.name: Robogem Deluxe
boardgame.description:
Plan the best route for your robot and collect most gems and return to your base before other players. Game for learning basics of programming.

The robot takes three commands: move forward, turn left and turn right. Players string these commands to guide the robots. Advanced games include functions that can contain many moves which can then be repeated when wanted.

First player to collect three gems and return them to their home base wins the game.

This game combines Robogem (2015) and Robogem: lisäkortit (2016)

boardgame.name: Défi Frise: Laval
boardgame.description:
Défi Frise: Laval, Frieze Challenge: Laval contains 42 cards representing 42 jewels of the city of Laval heritage.

Players take turns placing a card from their hand (of 7 cards) on the table (date face up) trying to reproduce a chronological frieze with the heritage sites cards.
On each card, architectural information and chronological indices are indicated.
The first player who manages to discard all his cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: Explore Fushimi Inari
boardgame.description:
With photos and memories from a few years ago, I set out to achieve a detailed, realistically designed recreation of the renowned Japanese shrine, Fushimi Inari Taisha. I feel like the real place has a very culturally unique significance, I personally had a great time exploring it a few years ago. I've designed this environment to be experienced from a first person perspective, with the aim of allowing the player to be immersed in the same kind of atmosphere as the real place.

The map is very extensive to explore with shrine gates laid out over the entire mountainside. I've tried to include a lot of variance in different parts of the mountain, with lots of points of interest to discover and many branching/intertwining paths to encourage you to make choices with your exploration. Take photos with the in-game camera, customize the soundtrack, walk around at your own pace. There is a checklist of locations to find as well as some hidden areas, and also a small ending.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Adventure Tactics: Into the Slimer-verse
boardgame.description:
Portals to the Slime-dimension are opening all around you and your party. Two giant slime monsters emerge from the portals and quickly move upon your party. Can you defeat the Ruby and Violet slime-lords and escape unscathed? If so, you may be able to acquire some amazing new loot!

The Into the Slimer-verse Promo Encounter is a single encounter pack meant to be played with Adventure Tactics: Domianne's Tower. It can be played as a single standalone encounter or a side quest played mid-campaign to earn extra loot!

The promo encounter pack includes a rules sheet with encounter set up description and 4 new loot cards that can only be earned from this promo encounter!


This promo pack was first introduced as a promo in the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign pack E*


-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tail Gun Charlie
boardgame.description:
Tail Gun Charlie is an arcade shooter where you must protect your bomber from ever-growing waves of Axis fighters.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Taps to Riches
boardgame.description:
Build your empire one city at a time in this new tap idler sure to make you money hungry! Tap to make money, tap to upgrade your city’s business buildings, and tap some more! Unlock, hire, and collect as many Advisors and Bizbots as you can to upgrade your business value, build your cities faster, and earn a stash of cash as you rise from rags to riches! Valuable Adviser bonuses will have you tapping even faster! Can you become a billionaire business tycoon or will you fail as a capitalist?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The cat's meow town
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Take care of the cats coming to your place.

boardgame.name: Keep An Eye Out
boardgame.description: Keep an Eye Out is a Living Game with various ways to play. The basic play is a reinvigoration of the classic parlour game “Winking Murder”. One Villain, and three Inspectors. The villain’s goal is to eliminate all other players by winking deliberately without being caught. The inspectors’ goal is to catch the villain in the act, and save everyone else from certain death.

boardgame.name: The Wordies
The Wordies Free
The Wordies PRO
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Find word chains among the letters scattered in the playfield.

boardgame.name: Siege of Khartoum
boardgame.description:
"The Siege of Khartoum" is a low to moderate complexity tactical wargame covering the Mahdist siege of Egyptian-held Khartoum during the Mahdist Revolution. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One side commands the Mahdist units and the other side commands the Egyptian and British units. Cards allow variety of play. The object of the wargame for the Mahdist player is to capture Khartoum while the Egyptian player attempts to hold out until British reinforcements arrive. The Siege of Khartoum utilizes a game system based on The Historical Game Company’s earlier "Battle of Quebec" wargame.

The game contains 48 5/8" counters, 20 cards, one game map and two dice.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aldira
boardgame.description:
Aldira is a competitive, strategic card game, which combines a bidding mechanic with deck building. The game is designed by Jakob Emmerling and Benjamin Steiger. It features more than 40 illustrations, of the beautiful jungle and its plants, by Ary Lieberwith.

In this game you are a native of a tiny village deep in the jungle. At this time of the year there is a competition, where you have to get and cultivate special plants and harvest their fruits.

Before each round, the players have to decide which actions they want to take and how much value they give these actions. To do so, each player secretly bid with their hand cards, for the actions.

For harvesting fruits, you get victory points. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Urban Dope Empire
Urban Drug Empire
boardgame.description:
Start your life as a drug dealer, make as much money as possible. Buy, sell and make big profits. Expand your empire and shoot your way to the top.

Start from the bottom and rise the ranks to drug kingpin!

Urban drug empire - The drug dealing life sim.


Buy low and sell high on the way to building your empire.



Rise the ranks from a nobody to drug kingpin.



Travel to multiple locations in order to buy and sell at the right price to maximise profits.



Plus more


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Jeu de l'Automobile
boardgame.description:
Jeu de l'Automobile is an antique and simple blast-racing game.

After assembling the models, the paper sheet is placed flat on a table and the characters arranged on the track at the discretion of the players.
By blowing lightly on the wing of the car the player has to drive the automobile to the garage, without overturning the figures and especially the car.
The winner will therefore be the one who knocks down the fewest characters.
A player who causes the car to fall, skips his turn, if it falls into the river that's the end of the game for him/her.

The rule can be changed at the discretion of the players.

Word Master PRO
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Word Quest PRO

Game intro

90 seconds limit, each created words adds seconds!

Get the best score possible before the time runs out!

boardgame.name: Murder of Crows
boardgame.description:
Murder of Crows is a somewhat cooperative, somewhat competitive murder mystery card game combined with tag.

At the start of a round, players gather in a circle and draw one card each, assigning them a role for the round. The player who draws the Crow card has to "kill" the other players.

Each player separates from the other players and goes into hiding, somewhat like hide and seek. However, some players will reveal themselves at times. For example, a character with the Shield needs to pass it on, and so, they will search for others to pass it to. The Hunter wants to be able to observe others in order to find out who potentially could be the Crow. The Crow needs to hunt (seek) the others. Typically the Seer and the Villagers try to hide but also be receptive to finding the Shield. And so, each turn is an interplay between hiding, finding out more information, and finding ways to end the round in their favor.

The Crow "kills" another player by simply whispering into their ear / near them, "You're dead." Alternatively, they can say, "You're dead; you're my Zombie" to the one chosen Zombie character per round. The Hunter "kills" another player by loudly saying, "Bam! You're dead!" then revealing that they are the Hunter. No other player has the capacity to kill, aside from if someone reveals to the the Crow when they are tagged "dead" that they have the Shield.

The other players have to identify the Crow and defend themselves with a "Shield." Some of the other players also have special abilities to partner with other players, defend themselves, or kill other players as well. The Shield must be passed from player to player every minute and is only way other players can protect themselves from being murdered.

Rounds can last from roughly 3 - 20 minutes. When a round is over, the cards are reshuffled, the Shield is reset, and a new round begins with the dealing of the cards. Participants can play as many rounds as they wish. No formal score keeping is necessary. The game is adaptable and comes with extra cards for the option of building out custom rules.

listing.notes: The game can be purchased here or via the game website, http://murderofcrowsgame.com/purchase/.

boardgame.name: 10 Fantasy Villages
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For every major trade city, for every capital and for every glimmering bastion of power and wealth there are dozens of smaller towns and villages scattered across the map. Many of them are hardly worth notice in your average campaign; they're little more than a wide place in the road between your party and their quest.

Sometimes you want those villages to stand out, though. You want to make them memorable, and add a little excitement to the journey between point A and point B while the party heads across the map. That's where this collection comes in! From the riverside town of Porthchurch, to the seaside boom town of Timbersong, and to the shores of the storm-lashed island of Coal Hall, this supplement has a little bit of everything.

Every town in this supplement has:

A map
A condensed history
Locations of Interest
Persons of Note
Rumours and Hooks

With 10 separate villages, and a total of 30 NPCs, unique locations, and rumours to help spice up your game, you can use these locations to fill in the gaps of your existing game, or build a whole new one around these unique locations and their secrets. It's up to you!

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

A separate zip file contains larger PNGs of the maps.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter, one the Table of Contents and one is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find, See and Hear in a Forest (Lore 100)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Characters may at some point be travelling through wooded areas, whether these be the comparatively tame woods of civilisation or the more dangerous wildwood of the uninhabited regions. Rather than simply glossing over these travels, this list provides 100 different encounters that can be used to make travel more interesting.

Some of the encounters have the potential to injure characters or animals whilst others may appear dangerous or more than they seem to be, yet not pose any hazard unless the GameMaster decides otherwise. So that the encounters are suitable, replace references to flora and fauna with ones appropriate to the region being travelled if needed.

The encounters are suitable for any system or setting, from ancient to futuristic, all that is needed is for characters to be travelling through woods. They can be used to simply add descriptions to an area being travelled, or might be used as potential adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Pit Trap - A pit trap has been dug into the ground here. The edges are crumbling, and the trap itself has been triggered and is empty. There may still be some sharpened wooden stakes in the bottom. (If a character approaches the edge of the pit it crumbles. An Average Athletics roll is needed by any character to avoid falling into the pit and suffering Ones +1 damage. A successful Acrobatics roll halves the damage. There are spikes in the bottom of the pit and those who fall in must make an additional Average Acrobatics roll or suffer an additional Ones damage. The spikes are filthy and any character injured by them must make an Average Endurance Resist roll or gain Condition: Diseased, PHQ.)

Poison Oak - Several nearby trees are wrapped in vines. The leaves of the vines slightly resemble those of an oak (unless it's winter, in which case they will have fallen to the ground). Any character who brushes against the vines with bare skin is highly likely to suffer an allergic reaction causing an itchy skin rash. (An Average Survival roll will identify the poison oak. If a creature touches them, they must make an Average Endurance Resist Roll or suffer 1d2 damage.)

Puddles - Several large puddles of water dot the ground here, presumably rain that has settled. The puddles are currently host to many tiny insects and insect larvae.

Rabbit - A rabbit runs across the track ahead, quickly followed by a fox, which briefly stops and stares at the players before continuing with its pursuit.

Rain - The branches of the trees overhead drip water as rain falls onto their upper reaches.

One page is the front cover and one page the front matter.

boardgame.name: Kissa
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Kissa is a web based game where the player need to take her cat for a walk. The was made by Kultisti.

boardgame.name: This That & Everything: America
boardgame.description:
This That & Everything: America is about all things related to the United States of America. Players race to describe people, places, and things related to America for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less! Be prepared to guess things from Norman Rockwell to North Dakota! Yeehaw!

Contents: 100 Double-Sided Cards, Score Pad, 30-Second Sand Timer, Instructions

boardgame.name: Forza Horizon 2: Storm Island
boardgame.description:
By Xbox.com:

The epic road trip continues on Xbox One with the expansion for Forza Horizon 2.

Storm clouds are gathering; a fierce tropical storm is about to break. Several of the world’s most iconic off-roaders are lined up, poised to spring with a punch of the gas pedal. Thunder crashes in the distance, an omen of the dangerous terrain and extreme elevation changes that await. Drivers grip their steering wheels, ready to tackle the epic challenges ahead. Welcome to a new land of extremes with the Forza Horizon 2: Storm Island expansion!

boardgame.name: RUMSKI
boardgame.description:
RUMSKI is a quick-thinking, Rummy-style strategy card game for 2 - 6 players. Combining parts of old favorites, plus new twists, you'll enjoy taking risks and setting a strategy to be the first to RUMSKI!

Each deck contains 70 cards, numbered 1 through 13 in five colored suits; plus five Wild cards

A great game for anyone who enjoys classic card games, with a new flair.

Players race to lay cards from their hands into matched runs and sets to the community. Once a player has contributed to the community, they can play off other players runs and sets, and they can move cards around the community as long as legal plays remain at the end of their turn.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: A quick-thinking, rummy-style, strategy card game for 2-6 players. Visit playcardboardgames.com to learn more! Use code BGG20 at checkout to save 20% on your very own copy or RUMSKI! And watch our YouTube tutorial here - https://youtu.be/NZyVne_qIr4

boardgame.name: Bases, Armies and Decks: Fantasy
boardgame.description:
Bases, Armies and Decks – Fantasy (also known as “BAD Fantasy”) is a table-top wargame which takes place in a fantasy setting. The game incorporates elements of base building, army roster creation and deck building.

Pregame
Prior to the initiation of a game players must make several strategic decisions. First, the player must choose an allegiance. There are four factions within BAD Fantasy each with their own unique playstyle or specialization: The Order (healing, defense), Infernal Legion (damage, offense), Mortis Cults (undeath, auras) or The Warband (effigies and luck). The player must then choose a Lord to lead their army. Lords are powerful heroes with unique abilities. Depending on the scenario or board size players are given a resource pool to recruit additional units. They must also create a deck of 30 cards which is supplemented by a Mastery system of an additional 10 cards.

Setup
Players roll for first placement. They highest roll goes first placing 5 units or “cubes” (cubes are terrain pieces). They players then alternate back and forth until all the starter cubes and armies are fielded. A second roll then occurs to determine who makes the first move.

Turns
Turns are structured in the following manner for each player:
1. Card Phase 1
a. Rotation of existing cards (cards may have vary durations…the corners of the cards determine the turn length that the effects will remain active)
b. Playing of cards from the hand
2. Board Phase
a. Movement/Building
b. Melee Resolution
3. Card Phase 2
a. Playing of cards from the hand
b. Drawing or holding to end the turn.

The Goal of the Game
A win condition is typically generated by killing the opposing Lord however there are other scenarios available.

boardgame.name: Il Gioco del Gran Premio
boardgame.description:
Il Gioco del Gran Premio, the Game of the Grand Prix is an accurate philological reconstruction of how this type of game was made eighty years ago, respecting materials and techniques of the time.
No plastic ! The cars are made of aluminum alloy, the nuts in enameled wood; paper and cardboard are deliberately opaque and with that slightly rough look of the old print.

Imagine being together with mythical drivers Nuvolari, Varzi, Rosemeyer, Caracciola and Chiron.
The fast Alfa Romeos, the powerful Mercedes and the elegant Bugattis are lined up on the starting grid.

Choose your car, put on a cap, gloves, goggles and get ready for the race.

The game can be customized for clubs and associations (with logo both on the box and on the board)

Content:
The game consists of a board with 34 squares representing the grand prix circuit, two decks of cards, 6 colored cars (inspired by the lines of the 1936 Alfa Romeo 12C) and a die.

boardgame.name: A Year in the Dwarven Realms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The culmination of the traveling bard Digby O’Flannagan’s year of Dwarven logs has arrived. In Digby's continuing logs he describes the various holidays, celebrations and fairs that he has seen in his travels. A Year in the Dwarven Realms collects all of the last year’s logs created as Digby journeyed through the various Dwarven kingdoms of the world. They are bound together for easy reference, reannotated by Digby and feature the collected notes of "The Healer" about the holidays presented in the logs, the month’s themes and a little on calendars and holiday design in general. If you enjoy Digby's writing style or just like to celebrate, this is the book for you. So, as Digby would say, “Keep a merry soul” and let’s see what the Dwarven Realms have to offer.

This product contains a month summary, alternate historical and fantasy names for the month and 4 fully fleshed-out holidays for every month of the year, as well as a game master section with an in-depth month theme discussion and advice on using each of the holidays presented in your game, including 4 unique plot hooks for each month. Coming in at a whopping 146 pages, you’re sure to find something to give your campaign a reason to celebrate.

This product contains all of the information found in the 12 separate issues of A Year of Celebrations in the Dwarven Realms.

boardgame.name: 100 Retiree Home Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of a hundred different things that you might find in the apartment or home of a retiree. Perfect for filling out a location in modern, wasteland, zombie outbreak, or even cyberpunk settings.

boardgame.name: 100 Artist Apartment Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of a hundred different things that you might find in the apartment, home, or dorm room of an artist. Some things are directly related to their talents while other stuff is needed for day to day living or leisure. Perfect for filling out a location in modern, wasteland, zombie outbreak, or even cyberpunk settings.

boardgame.name: Net Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From data cowboys to erratic AI entities to lonely losers looking for an easy score… the net is a lively place. This 30 sider roller features a bunch of colorful encounters that the GM can throw into the online side of their cyberpunk rpg game. Entry has a character name/online handle and some details.

boardgame.name: Mutant Flora
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The survivors stumble into a steaming jungle full of all kinds of weird plants.. Some of them moving. So what exactly is the flora like around here? And is it really safe? This mutant wasteland game supplements provides 20 different types of plants that the characters might stumble across. Though system generic there’s some choice bits of information in the entries to help the GM make the plants useful in their mutant campaign.

boardgame.name: Dwellings of Eldervale: Minotaur
boardgame.description:
Eldervale is a land of opportunity and rumors abound with skillful Mercenaries willing to fight for any side willing to pay. Mercenaries are optional Units (not Monsters) that may each be included separately at the beginning of any game.

Setup
To include a Mercenary, simply place the miniature of standee and corresponding Mercenary card in a central area that all players can see and reach at the start of the game.

Gameplay
As a Free Action on your turn, using either Gold or an Orb, you may hire a Mercenary. The hired Mercenary is placed directly into your Ready Area and is available for use. If you paid Gold to hire the Mercenary, it will be yours until the end of your next Regroup action. If you hired the Mercenary using an Orb, it is yours for the rest of the game.

The Exclusive Minotaur Miniature!

The Minotaur Miniature is a new mercenary class for Dwellings of Eldervale that comes in its own tuckbox - separate from any version of Dwellings of Eldervale. Included in the tuck box is the 50mm Minotaur miniature, standee, and corresponding game card.

The Minotaur
Charging into battle for your side, the Minotaur is a tough fighter. The Charge ability allows the Minotaur to Rush into adjacent Realms like Monsters. This ability is optional and is triggered whenever any opponent places in a Realm adjacent to the Minotaur. The Minotaur rolls 3 dice in battle.

-description from publisher

Liber Genus IX: Doppleganger

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

boardgame.name: Fur Road
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Fur Road is one of Hârn’s major trade routes, crossing the hilly, wooded Nuthela wilderness to connect the Kingdom of Orbaal in northern Hârn to the city of Tashal and other settlements in Kaldor. The road is one of the major routes for members of the Ilviran faith to make pilgrimage to the dwelling of their god at Araka-Kalai. The rough trail traverses the ranges of numerous colonies of Gargun (Hârnic orcs) as well as the unpredictable Anoa and Taelda barbarians. Wild beasts and natural hazards are a constant threat and casualties are common.

The Fur Road article covers the history and economic importance of the route, describes a typical caravan's daily routine and what travelers can expect on each segment of the trip, and provides descriptions of some interesting people that PCs may encounter.

boardgame.name: Habe Keep
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Habe is the principal human settlement of the Kingdom of Azadmere and the seat of the Baron of Habe, whose lands provide much of Azadmere’s food. The keep is one of Hârn’s oldest human fortifications and sits astride the paved road from Zerhun, guarding the ancient Gazhar Bridge. Few foreigners are permitted to travel beyond Habe to Azadmere City.

The Habe article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, economics, and military forces. It includes color GM and player maps of the settlement, brief descriptions of many local craftsmen and other locations, and color floor plans of the baron's keep and the town inn.

boardgame.name: Namadees Abbey
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Namadees is a Laranian abbey in the Kingdom of Chybisa. Built upon the site of the legendary final battle of St. Fardir, the abbey and its impressive temple are a popular destination for pilgrims. Namadees is held by the Order of the Spear of Shattered Sorrow, and is the heart of the Laranian Church's economic and educational activities in Chybisa. Abbot Jyka Misral and his like-minded followers are a thorn in the side of Chybisa's King Verlid VII, who they consider an apostate.
The Namadees article describes the abbey's history, government, religion, and economics. It includes color GM and player maps of the settlement, brief descriptions of many local craftsmen and other locations, and color floor plans of the abbey complex.

boardgame.name: DIE
boardgame.description:
- D - I - E -

"The Game of a Thousand Dice"

Deploy your dice, then strategically position rings within the arena to capture enemy dice when they - D - I - E - in a dice fight.

Use captured enemy dice as currency to buy upgrades and earn victory points.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: DIE on the Floor
boardgame.description:
6 dice each.
Lay out the rope in a ring on the floor.
Take turns throwing dice.
One's are wild and Two's are re-rolls (pick up to throw again later).
Throwing at other players dice to change the value or knock them out of the ring is encouraged!
Winner is the player with the most matching dice.
Only count dice that end up within the ring.
Dice value on matching dice breaks a tie.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Relentless Onslaught
boardgame.description:
Solo or 2 Player Co-op/Competitive.

Play as 1 or 2 Deck Officers aboard the S.S.C.R.O. (Sol Space Command "Relentless Onslaught"), affectionately called simply “The Crow” by its crew.

Use worker placement to claim ship resources and then allocate those resources to various weapons systems. Spend these resources to fire weapons and launch missiles & fighters at increasingly difficult waves of incoming enemy ships.

Target the correct enemy ships first to earn rewards, trigger combos and prevent certain types of incoming damage.

Enemy ships will damage the Crow’s energy shields and armour plating so some resources will have to be diverted from offensive systems to make repairs.

Upgrade your deck officers capabilities and the Relentless Onslaught itself to survive 6 waves and complete the game. Every wave is randomised so no two games are the same.

boardgame.name: Pharmacopoeia
boardgame.description:
Set collection game, where each set you make restricts your collecting options.

Draw varying quantities of coloured tablets from two piles on the table. Each time you make a set of 5, it blocks one of your draw options for that colour. If you have any incomplete sets of 5 at the end of the round they go to the waste tray.

Complete 'prescriptions' and set up cascading combos to be the most efficient pharmacist with the least wasted tablets.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rogue Deck
boardgame.description:
“The rogue gives chase, as the Twisted King flees into Darkness”

Play cards from your hand to:
Reveal what hides in the darkness.
Improve your deck by collecting upgrades.
Attack and defend against enemies.

Resolve all darkness cards, defeat the Twisted King and escape to the light.

Defeat the darkness enough times and at new difficulty levels to complete the ‘challenge card’.

The Rogue will die, frequently. Complete the ‘death card’ by dying enough times.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hyper Beam
boardgame.description:
HYPER BEAM
Power Force Ultra
GT Turbo

Card duelling game between two fighters stuck in a dead lock of opposing energy beams 'tug of war' style.

Draw 5 cards into your hand, top left corner denotes the cards type/ability/value, each card has two options (top and bottom).

After drawing cards, pick whether to use the top or bottom option by rotating cards in your hand so that the chosen option is at the top (these cannot be changed once chosen)

Players take turns playing cards to push the score marker towards their opponent on the score track. If a player pushes the marker to their opponents end of the score track, then that player wins the round.

Best of three rounds, wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Just Add Dice: Cannon Corps
boardgame.description:
Order your cannoneers to take aim at enemy forces, use your ammo strategically, and avoid incoming cannonballs to claim victory in Cannon Corps.

Each player uses their favorite set of seven standard role-playing dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d10%, d12, d20) on a 4-by-3 battlefield grid, obscuring enemies' view of their area. To start, they secretly place four dice on their highest face as platoons on any of their twelve grid spaces.

Players take turns choosing one of their platoons to fire with and one of the twelve grid spaces to aim at. Any enemy die that's hit suffers subtractive damage equal to the value shown on the firing die, and then has the option to move to any adjacent space. If a die fires with a value of 1, everything it hits is reduced to 0. After a die fires it is reduced by half, rounding down.

A die is removed from the battlefield when it is reduced to 0, and its commander replaces it with one of their three initially unused dice. Players are eliminated when their fourth die is reduced to 0, until just one triumphant commander remains!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Schoolyard Tricks
boardgame.description:
Remember the days of the old schoolyard... endless hours spent competing against your buddies in various childhood games; often resolved by Rock-Paper-Scissors or a simple Coin Toss.

Schoolyard Tricks is a trick-taking micro card game for 2 players that will help you to relive some of that old school fun in around 10-20 mins.

From a deck of just 15 cards, each player is dealt 6 cards in 3 suits (Rock-Paper-Scissors). Players will try to win up to 6 “tricks” each round. But the twist is that each time both players play Odd numbered cards, the Flip Card swaps to the opposite side - meaning the loser of the trick could win the points. And with just 15 cards, ties are resolved using Rock-Paper-Scissors - all recorded on a tug-o-war style board.

At the end of the round, the winning player adds their points to their total. Rounds continue until one player reaches 5 points, and are crowned the Schoolyard Champion.

Schoolyard Tricks contains a surprising level of strategy and decision-making for a quick, addictive, and highly portable, 15-card microgame.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Handbok för superhjältar rollspelet
boardgame.description:
"Upplev spännande äventyr! Kämpa mot skurkarna! Flyg fram över staden! Men du, glöm inte läxorna och dina plikter - dessa kan ställa till det för dig när du egentligen skulle behöva agera hjälte..."
Text from the back of the book

A roleplaying game based on the successful book series "Handbook for Superheroes", popular among Swedish kids. The authors of the novels co-wrote the RPG system and provided illustrations for the Core Rules book.

boardgame.name: Reversed Front: Dear Revolutionaries
boardgame.description:
Players have to lead a revolutionary organization, eliminate internal conflicts, expect the help of various countries, develop resistance organizations, use both peace and force to consume the energy of the Red Army, and accelerate the end of CCP's rulings.

Or play the role of the Red Army defending the rule of the CCP, defeating all separatists and revolutionaries with an iron fist, guarding social harmony and stability, national unity and national unity, realizing the great rejuvenation of the eastern mainland, and trying to win Taiwan.

Or play the role of the Taiwanese government, using the power of a maritime nation to intervene in the mainland situation, while attacking CCP agents and appeasers in China, using spy networks and covert actions to win this final battle.

From Novosibirsk to Jakarta, from the Pamirs to Sakhalin, 264 cities and towns across the land and sea in the game, unite the 8 countries in the east, mediate the 7 major powers, and liberate the motherland from the iron curtain built by the trade unions!

There are 9 powers for players to play in the game, and each power has different advantages and disadvantages. Different powers can choose different bases, which also means that the powers that can be relied on are different, and different game strategies will be developed accordingly.

boardgame.name: Word Search Unlimited
Word Search Unlimited PRO
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Find as many words among the mess of letters in the grid.

boardgame.name: Word Silent
WordPuzzle WordSilent
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Find the words with the given letters: Swipe among the letters in the right order.

boardgame.name: Residuel
boardgame.description:
Residuel is played on a rather egg-shaped arrangement of rhombuses. Players take turns placing a piece of their color that covers three mutually adjacent rhombuses. When there are no moves left, the player with the higher score is the winner.

The general idea behind the scoring is simple: You get 1 point per empty cell that is orthogonally adjacent to more of your pieces than your opponent's pieces. Two measures are taken to exclude all draws in as fair a manner as possible:

1: You get an extra point every time you make a placement that closes off an odd number of tied cells. (A cell is closed off when it is adjacent to no cell that can be occupied on a future turn.) This is equivalent to dividing tied cells between you in a "one for me, one for you, one for me"-fashion as they are closed off.

2: You get an extra point if your opponent has made more placements than you at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Phase II Clone Troopers Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Phase II Clone Troopers Unit Expansion

boardgame.name: Dansers
boardgame.description:
Dansers is a connection game where black tries to connect the north and south edge, and white tries to connect the east and west edge.

Players take turns placing two balls of each colour on the board, which must touch at the end of placement.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Stormtroopers Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Stormtroopers Upgrade Expansion
Star Wars: Legion – Stormtroopers Unit Expansion

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Troopers Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Troopers Unit Expansion

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – B2 Super Battle Droids Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – B2 Super Battle Droids Unit Expansion

boardgame.name: King's Castle
boardgame.description:
After the King's death two rival fractions compete for the Throne which is situated at the center of a 13-cell Castle.

The board is hexagonal with a Castle at its centre. There's a sufficient amount of checkers. There are two players, Black and White, who each direct an army of men that grows by placement, while the men also move as singles or in line, and may capture conditionally.

Play starts on an empty board and men are entered one by one outside the Castle and must organise themselves to enter it. Inside the Castle the fight goes on as both try to capture the Throne by occupying and holding two cells that are adjacent to it on opposite sides.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – B2-ACM Troopers / B2 Super Battle Droid Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – B2 Super Battle Droids Unit Expansion

boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Stormtroopers Upgrade Expansion

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Trooper Specialist / Rebel Trooper Captain Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Troopers Upgrade Expansion

boardgame.name: Zurvivors Cooperação
boardgame.description: Zurvivors Cooperação is a 2 player game that brings a cooperative mode to the universe of Zurvivors for the first time. With great intelligence and totally silent in order not to attract the zombies, the two players must make combinations of items and actions in a coordinated way to be able to rescue evidence that incriminates the giant corporation behind the incidents, in addition to finding the abandoned motorcycle in order to escape.

boardgame.name: River of Frozen Souls
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The River Of Frozen Souls has shattered. As the remnants of this once mighty frozen fortress drifts south on the Sea Of Broken Blades, it carries with it the Anvil of Ice, a powerful artefact capable of bringing eternal winter to the world. Will this winter be your last?

The River Of Frozen Souls is a generic adventure set in the frozen north that can be used in almost any fantasy setting. This product includes the following:

Adventure Background
Plot Synopsis
Three Chapters Detailing The Adventure
Travel hazards And Encounter Tables
17 Dungeon Location Maps
Dungeon Creation Rules
Dungeon Dressing Tables

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Phase II Clone Trooper / Z-6 Phase II Trooper Alternate Art
boardgame.description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Legion – Phase II Clone Troopers Unit Expansion

boardgame.name: Kutulu
boardgame.description:
"Kutulu är ett mysteriefokuserat regelsystem för Lovecraftianskt rollspel i 1920- och 30-tal. Det är ämnat som ett alternativ till existerande spel i samma genre."
From the back of the book

Translation:
Kutulu is a mystery focused ruleset for Lovecraftian role playing in the 1920s and 1930s. It is designed as an alternative to existing games in the same genre.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Promo Victory Tokens
boardgame.description: These promo tokens were given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2020 Season One. They can be used in place of the tokens supplied with the Star Wars Legion core game and / or expansions.

boardgame.name: Bosk: Winter Holiday Promo
boardgame.description: Promo includes holiday squirrel and four decorated trees with snow. No instructions come with them, so they substitutes for like pieces.
